cyclone.name: HENRI
cyclone.current_location: about 210 mi east of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast, then expected to slow and bend north-northwest toward Long Island and southern New England
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Long Island or the southern New England coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: N/A – no coastal watches in effect for Delaware
weather_observation.warning_coast: N/A – nearest warnings begin at Manasquan Inlet, NJ northward
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greatest impacts focused from New York City eastward across Long Island and coastal southern New England; lesser impacts Cape May NJ southward to Delaware beaches
weather_observation.wind: Occasional tropical-storm-force gusts possible Sunday, but overall probability is low (12% cumulative).
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–2 ft surge possible along the lower Delaware Bay; unlikely to exceed 3 ft at Wilmington.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain Sunday into early Monday could total 1–3 inches with localized street or small-stream flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along nearby Delaware beaches.
